Come join us for a voter education program and meet the candidates running for school board.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The Black vote hasn’t always mattered in the Ferguson-Florissant school district. For years, the Ferguson-Florissant school district’s voting system diluted the voice of Black residents.

That’s about to change. This Election Day, it’s your turn to be part of history.

Following a court order, residents of Ferguson-Florissant school district will use a new voting system called "cumulative voting."

On April 2, voters can cast two votes for the three Ferguson-Florissant school board candidates. Voters may cast both votes for one candidate, or split them by giving one to two different candidates.

Come School the Vote with us. Join us for a voter education presentation from the St. Louis County Board of Elections and school board candidate forum on Tuesday, March 26 at Greater Grace Family Church.

On April 2, be heard. Be represented. Be part of history. Vote.

We look forward to seeing you there,

ACLU of Missouri
